title: Portfolio
alt: A drawing of a cicada exuviae glowing in green
info: I created this portfolio website using NextJS and TypeScript.  I drew the cicada insect in Adobe Fresco.  The color scheme was inspired by Ani DiFranco's album, Evolve, which has been hugely influential in my life.

title: LendA
description: A web app that connects lenders to borrowers in a communities by providing a seamless experience.
alt: A screenshot of a website titled LendA, showing a search bar and outlines of various tools available to borrow.
info: Lenda was created in a program called CoLab.  I was the Front End Developer - my team used the MERN Stack for our tech.

title: BrewBrowser
description: An app made with ReactJS and the Brewery API that allows users to browse beers by style, create profiles, and save beers they've tried or would like to try to favorite lists and 'want to try' lists.
alt: A screenshot of a website titled Brew Broswer with a sketched beer fridge
info: BrewBrowser is a work in progress!  I drew the beer fridge and beer glass logo in Adobe Fresco and used CSS for the beer can animation.

title: Pack-Way
description: A web app that makes the process of planning trips for hikers and campers more efficient.
alt: A screenshot of a website called Packway, showing a cartoon person hiking with a walking stick.
info: Pack-way was created in a program called CoLab.  I was the Front End Developer on the team and I worked mainly with ReactJS.  We used a MERN Stack for this project's tech.

title: EmilySimpson.Art
description: A portfolio website for an artist locateed in New Orleans, LA.
alt: A screenshot of a website called Emily Simpson Art with marine plants at the bottom and bubbles throughout
info: Emily Simpson is an artist located in New Orleans, LA, whom I've worked with since 2019.  I created this portfolio website using ReactJS to showcase her head pieces.

title: Mal's Moderate Problem Blog
alt: A screenshot of a website called Mals Moderate Problem that shows the title of the website and several links to blog posts
info: I created this blog for two reasons -- a place to write about my journey with and without alcohol, and an opportunity to learn a CMS (in this case, Sanity).

title: Mindful Child Wellness
description: A website for an organization in Kansas City that teaches children mindfulness through breathing exercises and ariel yoga.
alt: A screenshot of the Mindful Child Wellness website showing a young girl and a woman doing poses in ariel yoga hammocks
info: The Mindful Child Wellness website was created by Social: Managed using WordPress.  I create and update images and content when needed.
